required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Plasma TMAO (Trimethylamine N-oxide) as a Predictive Marker in Coronary Disease Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Plasma TMAO (Trimethylamine N-oxide) as a Predictive Marker in Coronary Disease Patients

lead_sponsor.agency: Gdansk University of Physical Education and Sport

clinical_study.source: Gdansk University of Physical Education and Sport

brief_summary.textblock:
The primary aim of the current research project is to determine whether the TMAO concentration in the blood can serve as a prognostic indicator of myocardial infarction.
The hypothesis is that in patients with recent myocardial infarction, TMAO concentration in blood is higher than in patients undergoing scheduled coronarography.

detailed_description.textblock: To the study will be included volunteers - patients with stable angina (SA), who were scheduled for conventional coronary angiography, and patients with acute coronary syndrome (ACS) who were admitted to the hospital with chest pain and undergoing coronography surgery. Blood samples will be taken from volunteers once - before the coronography surgery by qualified medical personnel.

primary_outcome.description: TMAO concentration determined by the ultra-performance liquid-chromatography tandem mass spektrometry (UPLC-MS/MS).

arm_group.description: Patients with STEMI or NSTEMI infarction, who were admitted to the hospital with chest pain.
Patients with stable angina who were scheduled for conventional coronary angiography.
Healthy control group responding by age and gender to examined groups.

intervention.description: Trimethylamine N-oxide (TMAO) concentration will be determined in plasma samples

study_pop.textblock: Patients from the Pomeranian Cardiology Centers in Wejherowo

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- diagnosed stable angina (SA) or acute coronary syndrome (ACS) and planned coronography
Exclusion Criteria:
- unconscious patient

overall_official.affiliation: University of Physical Education and Sport in Gdansk

facility.name: University of Physical Education and Sport

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Gdansk University of Physical Education and Sport
